timeline.bodyText: Maybe change to Java syntax? ..something like mementoDatetimeStr
timeline.author: awoods

timeline.bodyText: The idea is that this class only handles internal IDs? I assume the expectation is that translation to an external representation will be handled at the http-api level?
timeline.author: awoods

replies.bodyText: I thought the agreement was that the existing HttpIdentifierConverter would handle the straight server name replacement and then this class would handle the more complex interpretation of the internal ID.
replies.author: whikloj

timeline.bodyText: What is this scenario? ..when there is something that follows fcr:versions... but not a memento identifier??
timeline.author: awoods

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I'm not sure if JAX-RS allows it but I wondered if you did http://localhost:8080/rest/object1/fcr:versions/ would you end up here. Perhaps we never hit it?
replies.author: whikloj

replies.bodyText: I can remove it and we can try an eventual integration test to see what happens.
replies.author: whikloj

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't do the same split twice.
timeline.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: Is the assumption that any trailing slashes were removed outside of this class? It might be worth doing a final trim here to be safe.
timeline.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: See what I did here when parsing mementos. I think you want to throw an exception here if there's a part after fcr:versions that isn't a parsable memento.
timeline.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: If this fails, I think it should throw a InvalidMementoPathException.
timeline.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: Again, I would avoid doing the same split multiple times.
timeline.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: Should there be any other constraints that are enforced in this class? Like maybe rejecting paths that include an empty element (eg a//b)?
timeline.author: pwinckles

replies.bodyText: We can do this and Fedora 5.1 does throw a 400 Bad Request error. But I have not been able to figure out where the exception is generated. It is possible it was Modeshape that did this.
replies.author: whikloj

timeline.bodyText: What if the id looks like a/b/fcr:acl/garbage? Should that be an error rather than simply throwing out the invalid content?
timeline.author: pwinckles

replies.bodyText:
Fedora 5.1 responds with:
> curl -ufedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin http://localhost:8080/rest/A/fcr:acl/test-garbage -i
HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Date: Mon, 23 Mar 2020 15:53:58 GMT
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=67t4kxw6llqe1gk3lq8rgj6gb;Path=/
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
Set-Cookie: rememberMe=deleteMe; Path=/; Max-Age=0; Expires=Sun, 22-Mar-2020 15:53:58 GMT
Content-Type: text/plain;charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 48
Server: Jetty(9.3.25.v20180904)

Error converting "fcr:acl" from String to a Name

What do we want to see with Fedora 6?
replies.author: whikloj

replies.bodyText: 400 makes sense. Just about any error message would be better than the 5.1 message.
replies.author: pwinckles

timeline.bodyText: Similar question here as the acl question above. At this point, there shouldn't be anything after fcr:metadata, right? If there is, should it be ignored or rejected?
timeline.author: pwinckles

replies.bodyText:
Same question here, what do we want? Fedora 5.1 does this:
> curl -ufedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin -i http://localhost:8080/rest/binary1/fcr:metadata/test-garbage
HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Date: Mon, 23 Mar 2020 15:57:55 GMT
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=1nsw8b5a9u9ok3kh3dzl5nnmn;Path=/
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
Set-Cookie: rememberMe=deleteMe; Path=/; Max-Age=0; Expires=Sun, 22-Mar-2020 15:57:55 GMT
Content-Type: text/plain;charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 53
Server: Jetty(9.3.25.v20180904)

Error converting "fcr:metadata" from String to a Name
replies.author: whikloj
